info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 11:06PM CDT until July 1 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Parker.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are forecast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Weatherford, Mineral Wells, Azle, Briar, Willow Park, Reno, Springtown, Hudson Oaks, Poolville, Cool, Lake Weatherford, Lake Mineral Wells, Annetta North, Millsap, Sanctuary, La Junta, Adell, Advance, Peaster and Agnes.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT TUESDAY
